articles.headline: Retail Jobs Don’t Need to Be Bad. Here’s Proof.
articles.snippet: Other industrialized countries offer an example, providing better wages and conditions for retail workers while employers still profit.
articles.abstract: Other industrialized countries offer an example, providing better wages and conditions for retail workers while employers still profit.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bethamy Magrow is grateful that the minimum wage in New York City is rising to $13 at the end of next month. Earning the current minimum of $11 an hour at a Times Square fashion retailer and scheduled to work some weeks for only 19 hours, the 25-year-old sales worker realizes she doesn’t quite clear New York’s poverty line.

articles.headline: North Korea Fires a Ballistic Missile, in a Further Challenge to Trump
articles.snippet: The missile flew higher than previous launches, and came despite President Trump’s warnings to the North.
articles.abstract: The missile flew higher than previous launches, and came despite President Trump’s warnings to the North.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — North Korea fired an intercontinental ballistic missile on Tuesday that flew both higher and longer than previous such launches, a bold act of defiance against President Trump after he put the country back on a list of state sponsors of terrorism.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler, Choe Sang-Hun and Helene Cooper

articles.headline: Rebuking Uber Lawyers, Judge Delays Trade Secrets Trial
articles.snippet: A letter from the lawyer of a former Uber employee detailed secretive efforts inside the company to monitor competitors and hide information.
articles.abstract: A letter from the lawyer of a former Uber employee detailed secretive efforts inside the company to monitor competitors and hide information.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — A letter that detailed a secretive effort at Uber to gather intelligence on competitors and cover its tracks has the ride-hailing company on the defensive in a legal fight that has gripped Silicon Valley since February.

articles.headline: Why German Markets Aren’t Worried About Angela Merkel. Yet.
articles.snippet: A strong economy and faith in Germany’s political system soothe investors. But the country’s prosperity may mask challenges down the road.
articles.abstract: A strong economy and faith in Germany’s political system soothe investors. But the country’s prosperity may mask challenges down the road.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — Europe over the past decade has endured government bond meltdowns, bank failures, right-wing populists and Brexit.

articles.headline: A Sharp Decline for Jimmy Fallon’s ‘Tonight Show’
articles.snippet: The latest ratings show that viewers are tuning out NBC’s fun-and-games approach and flocking to the politically engaged Stephen Colbert and Jimmy Kimmel.
articles.abstract: The latest ratings show that viewers are tuning out NBC’s fun-and-games approach and flocking to the politically engaged Stephen Colbert and Jimmy Kimmel.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ten months after Inauguration Day, the trend is holding: For late-night hosts, being sharply critical of President Trump is a winning strategy. And that is bad news for “The Tonight Show.”

articles.headline: Trump Feuds With Democrats Ahead of a Possible Government Shutdown
articles.snippet: In less than two weeks, much of the government will run out of money, but a negotiating session at the White House on Tuesday blew up after President Trump attacked Democrats.
articles.abstract: In less than two weeks, much of the government will run out of money, but a negotiating session at the White House on Tuesday blew up after President Trump attacked Democrats.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Less than two weeks before much of the government runs out of money, President Trump on Tuesday escalated the threat of a shutdown, accusing Democratic congressional leaders of plotting to use their leverage to raise taxes and flood the country with undocumented immigrants.

articles.headline: Republicans Clear Major Hurdle as Tax Bill Advances
articles.snippet: Republicans took a significant step forward on Tuesday when a key panel passed the $1.5 trillion tax cut, clearing the way for a full Senate vote later in the week.
articles.abstract: Republicans took a significant step forward on Tuesday when a key panel passed the $1.5 trillion tax cut, clearing the way for a full Senate vote later in the week.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senate Republicans took a significant step toward passing a sweeping tax overhaul on Tuesday, with a key panel giving its approval and several wavering senators indicating they would support the tax package, helping clear the way for full Senate consideration later this week.
articles.byline: By Alan Rappeport and Thomas Kaplan

articles.headline: Trump Once Said the ‘Access Hollywood’ Tape Was Real. Now He’s Not Sure.
articles.snippet: The president’s changing story, which has stunned advisers, is part of a lifelong habit of attempting to create his own version of reality.
articles.abstract: The president’s changing story, which has stunned advisers, is part of a lifelong habit of attempting to create his own version of reality.
articles.lead_paragraph: Shortly after his victory last year, Donald J. Trump began revisiting one of his deepest public humiliations: the infamous “Access Hollywood” tape of him making vulgar comments about women.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: The Internet Is Dying. Repealing Net Neutrality Hastens That Death.
articles.snippet: Over the last decade, a few giant corporations became an inescapable part of online life. Gutting net neutrality would cement their power.
articles.abstract: Over the last decade, a few giant corporations became an inescapable part of online life. Gutting net neutrality would cement their power.

articles.headline: NBC Fires Matt Lauer, the Face of ‘Today’
articles.snippet: Within hours of firing the show’s co-anchor, the network was said to have received more complaints, including one involving a 2001 encounter in his office.
articles.abstract: Within hours of firing the show’s co-anchor, the network was said to have received more complaints, including one involving a 2001 encounter in his office.
articles.lead_paragraph: The fast-moving national reckoning over sexual harassment in the workplace toppled another television news star on Wednesday when NBC fired Matt Lauer, the co-host of its most profitable franchise, “Today,” after an allegation of inappropriate sexual behavior with a subordinate.
articles.byline: By Ellen Gabler, Jim Rutenberg, Michael M. Grynbaum and Rachel Abrams

articles.headline: Trump Shares Inflammatory Anti-Muslim Videos, and Britain’s Leader Condemns Them
articles.snippet: President Trump shared video posts from a British ultranationalist, Jayda Fransen, including “Muslim Destroys a Statue of Virgin Mary!”
articles.abstract: President Trump shared video posts from a British ultranationalist, Jayda Fransen, including “Muslim Destroys a Statue of Virgin Mary!”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump touched off another racially charged furor on Wednesday by sharing videos from a fringe British ultranationalist group purportedly showing Muslims committing acts of violence, a move that was swiftly condemned by Britain’s prime minister as well as politicians across the spectrum.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Eileen Sullivan

articles.headline: G.M. Unveils Its Driverless Cars, Aiming to Lead the Pack
articles.snippet: Previously reluctant to show the autonomous vehicles it is developing, General Motors now wants to signal its progress in getting them to market.
articles.abstract: Previously reluctant to show the autonomous vehicles it is developing, General Motors now wants to signal its progress in getting them to market.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — For more than a year, General Motors has tantalized investors with plans to build its future around self-driving cars.
